definition: the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past, adjust so that a force is applied and an action occurs at the desired time
details:
noun
- the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past
- rhythm as given by division into parts of equal duration
= synonyms: meter, metre
- a person's experience on a particular occasion
= example: a person's experience on a particular occasion
- an instance or single occasion for some event
= example: an instance or single occasion for some event
= synonyms: clip
- an indefinite period, usually marked by specific attributes or activities
= example: an indefinite period, usually marked by specific attributes or activities
- a reading of a point in time as given by a clock
= example: a reading of a point in time as given by a clock
= synonyms: clock time
- the fourth coordinate that is required (along with three spatial dimensions) to specify a physical event
= synonyms: fourth dimension
- the period of time a prisoner is imprisoned
= synonyms: sentence, prison term
- a suitable moment
= example: a suitable moment
- a period of time considered as a resource under your control and sufficient to accomplish something
= example: a period of time considered as a resource under your control and sufficient to accomplish something
verb
- adjust so that a force is applied and an action occurs at the desired time
= example: adjust so that a force is applied and an action occurs at the desired time
- regulate or set the time of
= example: regulate or set the time of
- measure the time or duration of an event or action or the person who performs an action in a certain period of time
= synonyms: clock
- assign a time for an activity or event
= example: assign a time for an activity or event
- set the speed, duration, or execution of
= example: set the speed, duration, or execution of
